sn4.12:1.1: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.
sn4.12:1.2: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was teaching the Dhamma while surrounded by a large assembly.
sn4.12:2.1: Then it occurred to Māra the Evil One:
sn4.12:2.2: “This ascetic Gotama is teaching the Dhamma while surrounded by a large assembly.
sn4.12:2.3: Let me approach the ascetic Gotama in order to confound them. ”
sn4.12:2.4: Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and addressed him in verse:
sn4.12:3.1: “Why now do you roar like a lion,
sn4.12:3.3: For there is one who’s a match for you,
sn4.12:3.4: So why think yourself the victor?”
sn4.12:4.1: “The great heroes roar their lion’s roar
sn4.12:4.3: The Tathāgatas endowed with the powers
sn4.12:4.4: Have crossed over attachment to the world. ”
sn4.12:5.1: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.
